content: Yes, that's true! Part of the experience of eating Peking duck in Beijing is watching the chef carve the duck at the table. The chef uses a sharp knife to carefully and skillfully carve the crispy skin and meat from the duck, and then arranges the slices on a plate. This process is usually done in front of the diners, which creates a sense of anticipation and excitement. It's a traditional and artistic technique that is passed down from generation to generation in many restaurants.
